data.name: Check the Parentheses
data.description:
Most of nowaday calculators allow you to use parentheses so that
you choose which calculations you want to give priority. So the dilemma is... 
 
How does the calculator ‘know’ if parentheses are used appropriately?
 
 Essentially, each time '(' is casted the user should eventually press ')' also. 
 
The challenge i propose to you in this kata is that you build your own C function that can accomplish this fascinating task. 
 
Example:
```
(2x +  1) + 3(dy/dx)+ 1 = 0
 
// this string as well placed parentheses
```   
The function should be named ```checkParentheses()```. If well written, when the differential equation above is inserted, the function must return 1. 
 
In instances when the string has an incorrect use of parentheses the function should return 0.
 
Example:
```
)(4 + x )( = (dy/dx)
 
// this string does not have well placed parentheses
```   



  This is a simple kata, i made it so that it wouldn't be too tricky to create. Given that this the first one i’m making.
  
  PEACE
  
  Gonçalo Faria.
